fiotclient.context module¶

class fiotclient.context.FiwareContextClient(config_file)¶

Bases: fiotclient.SimpleClient

create_entity(entity_id, entity_schema)¶

Creates a new NGSI entity with the given structure in the currently selected service

Parameters:
  • entity_id – The id to the entity to be created
  • entity_schema – JSON string representing entity schema
Returns:

Information of the registered entity
get_entities_by_type(entity_type)¶

Get entities created with a given entity type

Parameters:entity_type – The type of the entities to be searched
Returns:A list with the information of the entities found with the given type
get_entity_by_id(entity_id)¶

Get entity information given its entity id

Parameters:entity_id – The id of the entity to be searched
Returns:The information of the entity found with the given id or None if no entity was found with the id
get_historical_data(entity_type, entity_id, attribute, items_number=10)¶

Get historical data from a specific attribute of an entity

Parameters:
  • entity_type – The type of the entity to get historical data
  • entity_id – The id of the entity to get historical data
  • attribute – The attribute of the entity to get historical data
  • items_number – The number of last entries to be queried. If no value is provided, the default value (10 entries) will be used
Returns:

The historical data on the specified attribute of the given entity
get_subscription_by_id(subscription_id)¶

Get subscription information given its subscription id

Parameters:subscription_id – The id of the subscription to be searched
Returns:The information of the subscription found with the given id or None if no subscription was found with the id
list_subscriptions()¶

Get all subscriptions

Returns:A list with the ids of all the subscriptions
remove_entity(entity_id)¶

Removes an entity with the given id

Parameters:entity_id – The id to the entity to be removed
Returns:Information of the removed entity
subscribe_attribute_change_with_rule(attribute, attribute_type, condition, action='post', notification_url=None)¶

Register a new rule to be evaluated on attribute values change and a action to be taken when rule evaluated to true

Parameters:
  • attribute – The attribute to be monitored
  • attribute_type – The type of the attribute to be monitored
  • condition – The condition to be evaluated on changes on attribute’s value
  • action – The action type to be taken when condition is evaluated true. Currently accepted values to this parameter are ‘email’ and ‘post’
  • notification_url – The endpoint to which POST notifications will be sent
Returns:

The information of the created rule
subscribe_attributes_change(device_id, attributes, notification_url)¶

Create a new subscription on given attributes of the device with the specified id

Parameters:
  • device_id – The id of the device to be monitored
  • attributes – The list of attributes do be monitored
  • notification_url – The URL to which the notification will be sent on changes
Returns:

The information of the subscription
subscribe_cygnus(entity_id, attributes)¶

Create a new subscription on attributes to send changes on its values to sinks configured on Cygnus

Parameters:
  • entity_id – The id of the entity to be monitored
  • attributes – The list of attributes do be monitored
Returns:

The information of the subscription
subscribe_historical_data(entity_id, attributes)¶

Create a new subscription on attributes to store changes on its values as historical data

Parameters:
  • entity_id – The id of the entity to be monitored
  • attributes – The list of attributes do be monitored
Returns:

The information of the subscription
unsubscribe(subscription_id)¶

Remove a subscription with the given subscription id

Parameters:subscription_id – The id of the subscription to be removed
Returns:True if the subscription with the given id was removed False if no subscription with the given id was removed
update_entity(entity_id, entity_schema)¶

Updates an entity with the given id for the new structure in the currently selected service

Parameters:
  • entity_id – The id to the entity to be updated
  • entity_schema – JSON string representing new entity schema
Returns:

Information of the updated entity

fiotclient.iot module¶

class fiotclient.iot.FiwareIotClient(config_file)¶

Bases: fiotclient.SimpleClient

create_service(service, service_path, api_key=None)¶

Creates a new service with the given information

Parameters:
  • service – The name of the service to be created
  • service_path – The service path of the service to be created
  • api_key – A specific api key to use to create the service. If no api key is provided, a random one will be generated.
Returns:

The information of the created service
static generate_api_key()¶

Generate a random api key to be used on service creation

Returns:The generated api key string
get_device_by_id(device_id)¶

Get device information given its device id

Parameters:device_id – The id of the device to be searched
Returns:The information of the device found with the given id or None if no device was found with the id
get_polling_commands(device_id, measurements)¶

Get a list of polling commands of the device with the given id when sending a measurement group or a list of measurement groups to the FIWARE platform from a device with POST request

Parameters:
  • device_id – The id of the device to verify pooling commands
  • measurements – A measurement group (a dict where keys are device attributes and values are measurements for each attribute) or a list of measurement groups obtained in the device
Returns:

The list of pooling commands of the device
list_devices()¶

List the devices registered in the currently selected service

Returns:The list of devices registered in the service
list_services()¶

Get all registered services

Returns:A list with the registered services
register_device(device_schema, device_id, entity_id, endpoint='', protocol='IoTA-UL')¶

Register a new device with the given structure in the currently selected service

Parameters:
  • device_schema – JSON string representing device schema
  • device_id – The id to the device to be created
  • entity_id – The id to the NGSI entity created representing the device
  • endpoint – The endpoint of the device to which actions will be sent on format IP:PORT
  • protocol – The protocol to be used on device. If no value is provided the default protocol (IoTA-UL) will be used
Returns:

Information of the registered device
register_device_from_file(device_file_path, device_id, entity_id, endpoint='', protocol='IoTA-UL')¶

Register a new device loading its structure from a given file

Parameters:
  • device_file_path – The path to the description file for the device
  • device_id – The id to the device to be created
  • entity_id – The id to the NGSI entity created representing the device
  • endpoint – The endpoint of the device to which actions will be sent on format IP:PORT
  • protocol – The protocol to be used on device. If no value is provided the default protocol (IoTA-UL) will be used
Returns:

Information of the registered device
remove_device(device_id)¶

Removes a device with the given id in the currently selected service

Parameters:device_id – The id to the device to be removed
Returns:Response of the removal request
remove_service(service, service_path, api_key='', remove_devices=False)¶

Remove a subservice into a service. If Fiware-ServicePath is ‘/*’ or ‘/#’ remove service and all its sub-services.

Parameters:
  • service – The name of the service to be removed
  • service_path – The service path of the service to be removed
  • api_key – The api key of the service. If no value is provided, default value “” will be used
  • remove_devices – If either its to remove devices in service/subservice or not. If no value is provided, the default value (False) will be used. This parameter is not valid when Fiware-ServicePath is ‘/*’ or ‘/#’.
Returns:

The response of the removal request
send_command(entity_id, device_id, command, params=None)¶
Sends a command from the FIWARE platform to a specific device
(http://fiware-orion.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user/walkthrough_apiv1/index.html#ngsi10-standard-operations at “Update context elements” section)
Parameters:
  • entity_id – The id of the entity that represents the device
  • device_id – The id of the device to which the command will be sent
  • command – The name of the command to be called on the device
  • params – The command parameters to be sent
Returns:

The result of the command call
send_observation(device_id, measurements, protocol='MQTT')¶

Sends a measurement group or a list of measurement groups from a device to the FIWARE platform

Parameters:
  • device_id – The id of the device in which the measurement was obtained
  • measurements – A measurement group (a dict where keys are device attributes and values are measurements for each attribute) or a list of measurement groups obtained in the device
  • protocol – The transport protocol to be used to send measurements. Currently accepted values are ‘MQTT’ and ‘HTTP’. If no value is provided the default value (MQTT) will be used
Returns:

The summary of the sent measurements
set_api_key(api_key)¶

Sets the api key to use to send measurements from device

Parameters:api_key – The api key of the service to use
Returns:None
update_device(device_schema, device_id, entity_id, endpoint='', protocol='IoTA-UL')¶

Updates a registered device with the given structure in the currently selected service

Parameters:
  • device_schema – JSON string representing device schema
  • device_id – The id to the device to be updated
  • entity_id – The id to the NGSI entity that represents the device
  • endpoint – The endpoint of the device to which actions will be sent on format IP:PORT
  • protocol – The protocol to be used on device. If no value is provided the default protocol (IoTA-UL) will be used
Returns:

Information of the updated device

fiotclient.utils.merge_dicts(*dict_args)¶

Merge two dicts into a single dictionary

Parameters:dict_args – The dicts to be merged
Returns:The resulting dictionary from the merge
fiotclient.utils.read_config_file(config_file)¶

Load configuration file and creates a dict with the necessary attributes

Parameters:config_file – The file to be read
Returns:A dict with the attributes read from the file

Module contents¶

class fiotclient.SimpleClient(config_file)¶

Bases: object

authenticate(username, password)¶
Generates an authentication token based on user credentials using FIWARE Lab OAuth2.0 Authentication system
If you didn’t have a user, go and register first at http://cloud.fiware.org
Parameters:
  • username – the user’s username from Fiware authentication account
  • password – the user’s password from Fiware authentication account
Returns:

the generated token and expiration
set_service(service, service_path)¶

Specify the service context to use on operations

Parameters:
  • service – The name of the service to be used
  • service_path – The service path of the service to be used
Returns:

None
